title: Store collected device IDs in 1Password vault
description:
Create Ansible task to populate 1Password vault with collected device IDs from all hosts.

## Implementation

Create `roles/syncthing/tasks/store_device_ids.yml`:

```yaml
# Copyright (c) 2026 T.R. Fullhart. All Rights Reserved.
---
- name: "Syncthing | Store device ID in 1Password"
  ansible.builtin.command:
    cmd: >
      op item edit "Syncthing Fleet Device IDs"
      {{ inventory_hostname }}[text]="{{ syncthing_device_id }}"
  delegate_to: localhost
  run_once: false
  changed_when: true
  register: op_result
  failed_when: op_result.rc != 0
```

```yaml
- name: "Collect and store Syncthing device IDs"

        name: syncthing
        tasks_from: collect_device_ids.yml

```

description:

## Reproduction
```bash

```

notes:
Issue was already fixed in commit 0ac1663 on 2026-01-16 by T.R. Fullhart.

**Root Cause**: apt/pacman cache update tasks in local.yml Pre-run Setup play failed during check mode due to permission/locking issues.

**Solution**: Added 'ignore_errors: {{ ansible_check_mode }}' to both apt (line 30) and pacman (line 37) cache update tasks. This allows cache update failures to be ignored in check mode while still failing in normal execution.

**Verification**: Ran 'mise run dry-run-local' successfully on 2026-01-27. PLAY RECAP: ok=38, changed=1, unreachable=0, failed=0, skipped=10.

Commit message: 'fix(local.yml): ignore apt/pacman cache update errors in check mode. Fixes: fleet-238'

title: Configure firewall rules for optimal Syncthing peer connectivity
description:
Ensure firewalls on all fleet hosts allow Syncthing traffic for direct peer-to-peer connections, reducing reliance on relay servers and improving sync performance.

## Background

Syncthing uses multiple connection methods with fallback priorities:
1. **Direct TCP (port 22000)** - Fastest, lowest latency
2. **Direct QUIC (port 22000/UDP)** - Fast with better NAT traversal
3. **Local Discovery (port 21027/UDP)** - LAN device discovery
4. **Global Discovery** - Internet-based discovery via discovery servers
5. **Relay Servers** - Fallback when direct connections fail (slowest)

Without proper firewall rules, Syncthing falls back to relay servers which adds latency and reduces throughput. This epic ensures direct connections work optimally.

## Scope

**In Scope:**
- Configure ufw (Linux) to allow Syncthing ports
- Configure pf/application firewall (Darwin) to allow Syncthing
- Support both IPv4 and IPv6
- Document firewall configuration in role README
- Validate firewall rules applied correctly
- Test connectivity between peers after firewall configuration

**Out of Scope:**
- Router/gateway firewall configuration (manual, environment-specific)
- Port forwarding configuration (UPnP handles this automatically)
- VPN/ZeroTier firewall rules (handled by those services)
- Custom Syncthing port configuration (uses defaults)

title: Apply templated config.xml to Syncthing instances
description:
Create Ansible task to apply templated config.xml to all Syncthing instances, backing up existing config first.

## Implementation

Create `roles/syncthing/tasks/apply_config.yml`:

```yaml
# Copyright (c) 2026 T.R. Fullhart. All Rights Reserved.
---
- name: "Syncthing | Stop Syncthing service before config change"
  ansible.builtin.systemd_service:
    name: "syncthing@{{ user_name }}.service"
    state: stopped
    scope: user
  when: ansible_facts.system | lower == 'linux'

- name: "Syncthing | Backup existing config"
  ansible.builtin.copy:
    src: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/.config/syncthing/config.xml"
    dest: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/.config/syncthing/config.xml.backup.{{ ansible_date_time.epoch }}"
    remote_src: true
    mode: '0600'
  when: syncthing_config_exists.stat.exists

- name: "Syncthing | Check if config exists"
  ansible.builtin.stat:
    path: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/.config/syncthing/config.xml"
  register: syncthing_config_exists

- name: "Syncthing | Apply templated config"
  ansible.builtin.template:
    src: config.xml.j2
    dest: "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/.config/syncthing/config.xml"
    owner: "{{ user_name }}"
    mode: '0600'
    backup: true
  notify: restart syncthing

- name: "Syncthing | Validate config XML syntax"
  ansible.builtin.command:
    cmd: xmllint --noout "{{ ansible_env.HOME }}/.config/syncthing/config.xml"
  changed_when: false
  failed_when: false
  register: xmllint_result

- name: "Syncthing | Fail if config invalid"
  ansible.builtin.fail:
    msg: "Invalid XML syntax in config.xml"
  when: xmllint_result.rc != 0
```
